CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C01

TITLE.P: Invitation to 2nd Provider Engagement Event, Newham CCG Building Healthy Communities.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Newham CCG is planning an ambitious transformation of its community health services over the next 5 years.
As part of our next steps and following on from your feedback, a 2nd provider engagement workshop will be held on 9.6.2016 to share with you the work which the CCG has done so far on:
— The design of the Future Care Model;
— Innovative Contracting Models for Community Health Services;

The purpose of these workshops is to truly engage at a very early stage with providers to get their perspectives and also embed lessons learnt from the different procurements happening across the NHS.
Details of our 1st provider event can be found on our website at: http://www.newhamccg.nhs.uk/GetInvolved/provider-engagement.htm
Details of our 1st provider event can be found on our website at: http://www.newhamccg.nhs.uk/GetInvolved/provider-engagement.htm
As part of our next steps and following on from your feedback, a 2nd provider engagement workshop will be held on 9.6.2016 to share with you the work which the CCG has done so far, on:
— The design of the Future Care Model;
— Innovative Contracting Models for Community Health Services;

The CCG is keen to ensure that these workshops capture all interested providers perspectives on the future model of care whilst also taking into consideration the lessons learnt from similar procurement programmes happening across the NHS.
Details of the 2nd provider event as follows:
Venue: The Will Thorne Chamber, Old Town Hall, 29 Broadway, Stratford, E15 4BQ.

INFO_ADD.P: The invite is open to any providers who have an interest in community health services and/or are currently in community health services related business. As a provider of care, this represents a unique and early opportunity to share innovation and practices centered around the patient to deliver the outcomes that matter most to patients. The event also provides an opportunity for providers to meet 1 another and network.

Please note that this is a market testing exercise to inform the organisation's decision making process, not a call for competition. This does not commit the CCG to carry out a procurement process. Bidders who have expressed an interest in this market testing exercise will have to submit a separate response to the Contract Notice should we decide to procure this service and publish a Contract Notice (advert) for this requirement.

We are proposing a contract to commence in early 2018. The duration of the contract is being considered in light of feedback from the 1st provider event held on 11 April. All dates stated are variable. The contract value range will be clarified following detailed scoping but it is anticipated to be in the range of 100 GBP-200 000 000 GBP over a 3 year period.

Potential providers with relevant technical capability and experience to deliver this service are invited to express an interest in this market testing exercise by sending an e-mail to WELCPOD-procurement@nelcsu.nhs.uk for the attention of Hiran Karunaratna by 17:00, 1.6.2016. Places are limited to 2 people per organisation.
To view this notice, please click here: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/delta/viewNotice.html?noticeId=202005392
